classification_criteria.GOOD: Text readable, semantically correct, foreign words spelled correctly
classification_criteria.BAD: Multiple garbled words, key terms misspelled, names corrupted, gibberish

note: Footnote markers merged with words (e.g., 'word23') are not counted as errors. German/Greek/Latin/philosophical terms expected.

Philosophical German terms intact: Dasein-related concepts present

patterns_observed.footnote_corruption: Pages 363-368, 376-377 have minor footnote artifacts; pages 380-396 have severe corruption in notes/references sections
patterns_observed.german_compound_words: Systematic issues with German compound words and diacritics (ü, ö, ä, ß). Examples: Tübingen→tiibingen, Würzel→vieifache
patterns_observed.proper_names: Bibliography and reference pages (380-396) show 15-30% error rates for proper names, especially multi-language names
patterns_observed.philosophical_terminology: Core Heidegger concepts mostly preserved (Dasein, Sein, Seiendes, Being, Thought) even in degraded pages
patterns_observed.greek_latin_text: Greek characters corrupted (twv instead of tōv), Latin corrupted, especially in reference sections
patterns_observed.publication_metadata: Edition numbers, page numbers, publication details unreliable in notes/references
patterns_observed.diacritic_loss: Systematic loss of German umlauts and accents throughout batch, particularly in proper names and compound words

quality_assessment.main_text_quality: Pages 363-376 (main philosophical text): GOOD-MARGINAL quality (2.7-6.5% error rates). Highly readable.
quality_assessment.notes_sections: Pages 380-396 (editors' notes, references, bibliography): BAD quality (11.5-29.7% error rates). Require manual verification.
quality_assessment.overall_usability: Main philosophical content usable for scholarly purposes with light proofreading. Bibliography/references section unsuitable for automated citation extraction.
